Footage showing the third Russian strike on the Pechenihy Dam in Kharkiv Oblast. This one was carried out with a Tornado-S rocket. 
The road over the Pechenihy Dam is one of the main logistical routes for Ukrainian forces for the Vovchansk - Kupyansk sector of the frontline.
Coordinates: 49.88225, 36.98039

 Footage of Cambodian forces firing BM-21 rockets toward the Surin-Oddar Meanchey border area.
@wfwitness

In the Kostyantynivka direction, Russian forces continued their assault operations in and around Kostyantynivka and have made new progress in four different areas.
In the northeast, following the capture of the tram depot on the northern edge of the Santurinivka District, Russian forces broke into the forest to the northeast, capturing positions there and in the trench fortifications in the adjacent fields. After accumulating, they pushed further northeast up the highway and forests, capturing the remaining positions south of the Dovhenka Arroyo Gulley, while other forces captured the remaining field fortifications near Predtechyne and the cafe on the eastern edge of the forest.
From there, Russian forces crossed the Dovhenka Arroyo Gulley and entered the northern part of the forests, infiltrating the Metallurg Dachas, the Khimik Dachas, the electrical substation, and the cemetary. DRGs moved even further north, entering the treelines northeast of Kostyantynivka. DRGs are also continuing to operate in the western forests and in the eastern streets of the Hora District.
To the southwest, Russian forces continued taking new positions in the Santurinivka District and consolidated in six more low-rise residential blocks southwest of the tram depot. They also managed to push the Ukrainians back out of the Michurina Dachas in southeastern Kostyantynivka. 
To the south, Russian forces continued slowly advancing north of the Kleban-Bykske Reservoir. They captured additional positions in the forests of the Kleban-Byk Landscape Park and expanded their zone of control in the trench fortifications west of Pleshchiivka.
+ ~9.53 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Overnight, in southern Syria, violent clashes took place between STG government forces and the Suweida Military Council (SMC) on the frontline west of Suweida City and in the area of Al Majdal. 
No casualties were reported, but power outages occurred in some settlements north of Suweida due to a stray bullet hitting a powerline.

Overnight, in southern Syria, violent clashes took place between STG government forces and the Suweida Military Council (SMC) on the frontline west of Suweida City and in the area of Al Majdal. 
No casualties were reported, but power outages occurred in some settlements north of Suweida due to a stray bullet hitting a powerline.

On the northwestern flank of Kostyantynivka, Russian forces continued their intensified assault operations and have advanced in two different areas.
In the northwest, Russian forces continued pushing west from the area of Maiske. They advanced west along a treeline, and west from the Maiske - Virolybuivka Road, capturing new positions on the tactical heights northeast of Virolybuivka. From there, Russian soldiers managed to enter the northern part of Virolybuivka, while DRGs infiltrated even further west and across the Novyi Reservoir in the direction of Klynove.
In the southeast, Russian forces began counterattacking in the southern suburbs of Chasiv Yar. They were able to recapture the Levanevskoho District, pushing the Ukrainians back to the southwestern Pivdennyi District.
+ ~4.50 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Russia is currently carrying out large-scale military exercises in the Far East.
At least 5 Tu-95MS strategic bombers from Ukrainka Airbase, ships from the pacific fleet stationed in Vladivostok, and an A-50U AWACS aircraft are taking part. 
The strategic bombers are carrying out simulated launches of Kh-101 cruise missiles with electronic warfare in the Sea of Japan. They are communicating ground controllers "Tainy, Bocheka, Rangut, Senokos, Vyazanka," and carrying out launch maneuvers with the launch code "333". 
These exercises will undoubtably delay the next large-scale, combined missile and drone attack on Ukraine involving strategic aviation, however there is still a possibility for large-scale missile attacks to take place without bombers due to a large number of Geran-2 drones still accumulated at launch sites, as well as recent Iskander-M deliveries to OTRK installations.

Russian media report that a Russian An-22 military transport aircraft crashed in Ivanovo Oblast. 
The plane reportedly had 7 crewmembers onboard at the time. Search and rescue operations are underway.

On the southwestern flank of Siversk, Russian forces continued to advance and have made significant progress across three different areas.
In the southwest, Russian forces managed to break through Ukrainian positions in the eastern part of Orikhovo-Vasylivka, quickly capturing the rest of this village which had held for over a year. Additionally, they were able to secure the treelines to the southwest and northeast, as well as the rest of the gulley to the east. From there, Russian forces pushed north to the forest along the E-40 Highway, capturing the southern part of it. In response to these somewhat sudden Russian advances, Ukraine blew up the Pryvillya Dam in an attempt to slow them down. 
To the northeast, Russian forces continued pushing west from the Bakhmutovka River. They consolidated in positions directly east of Pazeno, before entering the village, which is now in the grey-zone. They also managed to secure a number of the trenches north and northwest of Sakko i Vansetti which have held since March 2023. 
+ ~9.32 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Siversk and Lyman directions, Russian forces continued their assault operations and have made significant progress over the last week. 
In the southeast, Russian forces managed to consolidate in most of the high-rise buildings of northeastern Siversk. From there, they advanced southwest and captured the railway station, while other forces advanced west to the city centre. 
Additionally, Russian forces eliminated the pocket to the southeast of Siversk, and in coordination with attacks from the southern outskirts, established control over the southeastern part of the city, largely levelling the frontline along the railway line. Ukrainian forces have mostly withdrawn from the main part of Siversk east of the Bakhmutovka River, while Russian forces are attempting to infiltrate the western suburbs. They also managed to capture the terykon north of the city.
To the northwest, the Russians continued advancing beyond Platonivka and captured the forested gulley south of the village. They also advanced through the forest plantations to the southwest and captured the southeastern streets of Zakitne. 
Further northwest, Russian forces captured the remaining part of the forests north of Zakitne and cleared the positions in the forested area on the northern bank of the Siverskyi Donets River. 
To the west, the Russians captured the crossroads north of Ozerne and continue attempts to enter the northern part of the village amid fierce fighting. Additionally, Russian forces managed to capture the northern and eastern parts of Dibrova, as well as the forests to the east and southeast. Marginal advances also took place west of the two reservoirs in the direction of the highway.
+ ~29.57 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Lyman direction, Russian forces continued their assault operations and have made new progress in three different areas.
In the southeast, Russian forces continued to incrementally advance through the fields east of Lyman, amid heavy fighting. They were able to establish control over additional positions in the treelines south of the Zarichne - Lyman Road, and are attempting to advance further west.
To the north, Russian forces resumed their assault operations northeast of Lyman and have captured additional positions in the western part of the Pen'kovyy yar Gulley. 
In the northwest, after an earlier withdrawal, Russian forces re-entered the agricultural complex on the northeastern outskirts of Dobrysheve and established full control over it. 
+ ~2.20 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Borova direction, Russian forces resumed their assault operations in the western part of Luhansk Oblast and have made new progress in the direction of the Luhansk - Kharkiv regional border.
Russian forces advanced northwest up both banks of a tributary of the Zherebets River, capturing new positions in 7 different treelines. They also managed to gain a foothold in the eastern part of the Lomovaty Forest and advanced further northwest in the direction of the Borovy Forest.
+ ~4.31 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Kupyansk direction, both Russian and Ukrainian forces are advancing, each focusing on a different side of the Oskil River.
In the west, Ukrainian forces recaptured the forests southwest of Kupyansk and made additional progress in the southern streets of the city. They also advanced from the village of Moskovka into the northwestern streets, as well as from the western suburbs towards the city centre, where they are now fighting for the area of the train station - bypassing Russian strongpoints in the northwestern suburbs from the south. Meanwhile, Russian forces repelled the Ukrainian attacks in the Yuvileynyi high-rise micro-district, and regained control over its western apartment buildings.
Since then, after heavy fighting, Ukrainian forces managed to establish control over a number of enterprises along the R-79 highway and infiltrated the northern streets of Kupyansk, therefore blocking Russian logistics and operationally encircling their garrison in the part of the city west of the Oskil River.
In the east, over the last week Russian forces have made significant progress east of the Oskil River. They advanced for over 2.6 km down the road across open ground to the northern outskirts of Petropavlivka and entrenched in its northern street. From there, after bringing in reinforcements, the Russians pushed southwest to the eastern bank of the Hnylytsya River and south to the centre of Petropavlivka, establishing control over the forest plantations north of a tributary of the Hnylytsya River. Attacks are now underway towards the eastern part of the village; however the situation in the centre of the settlement and nearby areas remains somewhat fluid and dynamic. 
To the southeast, Russian forces resumed their assault operations on the southeastern part of Petropavlivka and gained a foothold in the first houses of the village. Other assault groups managed to capture positions in the forested area to the south. 
+ ~8.53 km¬≤ in favour of Russia. 
+ ~5.80 km¬≤ in favour of Ukraine.

In the Kupyansk direction, both Russian and Ukrainian forces are advancing, each focusing on a different side of the Oskil River.  In the west, Ukrainian forces recaptured the forests southwest of Kupyansk and made additional progress in the southern streets‚Ä¶

Close-up view of the situation in Kupyansk, where Russian forces have been operationally encircled in the western part of the city:
The yellow lines represent the former Russian supply routes, which are now largely impassable due to the presence of Ukrainian soldiers there, who managed to reach the western bank of the Oskil River. This has been achieved after weeks of Ukrainian counterattacks. There is currently no evidence of consolidation there, however.
The red shows the main Russian strongholds in western Kupyansk, which the Ukrainians are either bypassing or directly assaulting. 
The situation has reached this point due to a severe lack of Russian manpower within Kupynask. This is due to a lack of Russian consolidation north of the city, making logistics (which already have to go over the river further north which is monitored 24/7 by Ukrainian drones) incredible difficult. For this reason, Russian soldiers in western Kupyansk likely number between just 200 and 400.
The fact that Russian forces managed to break into Kupyansk and quickly capture large parts of the city is evidence of how poorly the Ukrainian defence was initially conducted here, and how critical their manpower shortages were. 
However, due to reinforcements being brought in, Ukraine achieved a localised numerical superiority in this area, which is allowing for them to carry out these successful counterattacks. 
This is why I warned about this sector a week ago, and how it could become critical for Russian forces. Since then, the situation has absolutely reached a critical level.

I keep seeing people ask me how to access my interactive Ukraine map, so I might start linking it under each map update like Suriyak. Remember, all updates are posted there first, although some changes may be clarified and adjusted before I make a written report.
I will only do that on Telegram though, as posting links to other sites on Twitter kills your reach. 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/0/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll=49.55942754881313%2C37.24161958921334&z=8

Iskander-M ballistic missiles continue to be delivered to OTRK installations near Ukraine.
Recently, IL-76MD military transport aircraft have landed at Baltimore Airbase, Voronezh Oblast, and at Rostov-on-Don-Central Airbase, Rostov Oblast. Iskanders will be delivered by road to OTRK installations near Liski, Voronezh Oblast, and near Taganrog, Rostov Oblast. The cargo likely also consisted of Geran-2 drones which will be transported by rail to launch sites.
Additionally, an IL-76MD landed at Engels-2 Airbase, carrying Kh-101 cruise missiles in preparation for the next large-scale, combined missile and drone attack on Ukraine. These missiles will be equipped to Tu-95MS/Tu-160M strategic bombers once they return from their large-scale training missions in the Far East.
Locations Of US Carrier Strike Groups ‚Äì December 9, 2025

Sahel States Threaten Nigeria Over Airspace Violations After C-130 Emergency Landing 
The Confederation of Sahel States (AES), which includes Mali, Burkina Faso, and Niger, announced on December 8 that it will neutralize all aircraft violating its airspace, following reports of violation by Nigeria.
In an official statement, the alliance explained that a Nigerian Air Force C-130 aircraft made an emergency landing in Burkina Faso, and an investigation by Burkinabe authorities revealed that the landing was unauthorized.
The AES condemned ‚Äúin the strongest terms‚Äù the violation of its airspace, and stressed that the air defenses of the alliance are authorized to ‚Äúneutralize all aircraft that would violate the confederal airspace.‚Äù

Israeli Army Storms Southern Syria Town And Clashes With Local Causing Casualties (Videos)
A unit of the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) stormed on December 9 the town of Khan Arnabeh in the southern Syrian governorate of Quneitra and clashed with the locals, causing casualties.
The unit set up checkpoints all around Khan Arnabeh, restricting the movement from and to the town. When a group of locals gathered near one of the checkpoints to protest, Israeli troops opened fire. Syrian state TV said that three people were wounded as a result.
Speaking on the sideline of the annual Doha Forum in Qatar on December 6, Syrian President Ahmad al-Sharaa made some of his sharpest comments against Israel to date.
Read more 
HERE

Russian Army Now Controls Most Of Siversk (Videos)
On December 9, the Russian military expanded its control inside Siversk, capturing more than 60-70% of the city, one of the largest in Donetsk, according to varying sources.
The Yug [South] Group of Forces first advanced in the center of Siversk, along the railway, from south to north, capturing most of this part of the city. Russian troops then broke through Ukrainian defenses in the southwestern part of the city, and began advancing from there into the urban areas in the western part.

Russian Army Captures Town In Dnepropetrovsk, Keeps Pressure On Zaporozhye (Videos)
On December 9, the Russian military captured another settlement in Dnepropetrovsk, all while maintaining pressure on Kiev forces in neighboring Zaporozhye.
Ostapovskoye, located in the area where the Yanchur River splits from the Haichur River in Dnepropetrovsk, was captured by the Vostok [East] Group of Forces, according to the Russian Ministry of Defense, which noted in a statement that the attack on the settlement was led by the the 36th Separate Guards Motorised Rifle Brigade of the 29th Army.
Further south along the Haichur in Zaporozhye, the Vostok Group of Forces continue to battle Kiev forces inside Varvarivka, as well as in the area north of the key city of Huliapole.
